Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: JacQuiandMarkGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the previous reviews we selected this hotel. The review by 'Travelgirl' was very helpful regarding the T10 ticket. We bought the ticket at the airport, however the tourist information told us to go to the train station to buy the ticket. This was a bit of a walk but we were in no hurry. The L77 bus was perfect. It took approx. 40 minutes and it terminates right outside the hotel. We were told by hotel staff that the quickest way to the centre of the city was to take the tram T3 which is a 5 minute walk away on the other side of the hospital across the road from the supermarket. Take this to the stop Palau Reial then transfer to the Metro (same name). This takes you to the Pl Catalunya. The best part of this is that if you are using the T10 ticket this counts as only one journey. (Remember to validate the ticket on both the Metro and the tram) The total journey time is approx 50 minutes but for less than 1 euro per person it is very good value. The hotel was clean and the apartments very large. We had a lounge area and a bedroom. There was a kitchen area which we did not use (we were only there 3 nights) but the bathroom was very clean and modern and plenty of hot water. We asked from a room as high up as possible and we were given one on the 8th floor. This has great views over the city and up to the hills. There was also a free safe in the room...excellent. The area around the hotel was very residential. Lots of small cafe/bars. We found a very good one...turn left out of the hotel, left again. Proceed down the road with the TV studio on your right. At the end of the road you will see an office block called Smith & Nephew turn left. The cafe/bar is called Cruixent. We were concerned about all the reviews regarding pick pockets etc, In the 3 days we were there we did not see anything nor did we feel intimidated at any time, including the city centre, the Metro and the Tram even though we used these well after midnight. Our 1st time in Barcelona will not be our last. We were quite happy to travel into the city and would certainly use the hotel again it was great value for money. The L77 bus leaves outside the hotel back to the airport but it goes to T1 first and waits there for 10 minutes before going on to T2. This takes around 1 hour.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel long way from City Centre”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl181747
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very spacious and all of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful – particularly those in housekeeping. The hotel really is a long way from downtown Barcelona but if we did it again I think I would stay there again anyway. The info provided here by other travelers was invaluable but I hope to add to it to make it even more helpful! There are pros and cons to this location. Pros: the neighborhood is quiet and feels very safe. There is a terrific grocery store within walking distance and there are buses outside the door of the hotel as well as 2 tram lines an easy walk away. The rates at this hotel are amazing. We booked two rooms for 4 people. One was a suite with a separate bedroom and the other was a standard hotel room. I am quite sure we paid less for these 2 rooms than 1 would have cost in the city centre. Cons: When you stay this far outside the city, you tend to make only one trip into town each day. That means that everything you need will have to be carried with you and anything you buy will travel with you all day. If your hotel is in the city centre you will have access to at least one clean bathroom – if you stay in San Joan Despi, you don’t have this option! Transit The L77 leaves from both terminal 1 and terminal 2. Just ask at the airport information desk and they will direct you to the bus stop. The L77 is part of zone 1 of the bus system. If you are going to use public transit while in the city consider getting a multiple use pass. If you are traveling alone, there are lots of options for the pass but if you are traveling with others, you need to get the T-10 or the T-Familiar 70/30 in order to use the pass for more than one person. You can buy the pass at the bus stop at the airport. Each individual ride is 2 euro but with the pass is less than 1 euro per trip. If you are going to the beach, you can board the 157 bus right in front of the hotel. The trip takes an hour and 15 minutes but it is a fabulous way to see the city and you don’t have to transfer. I actually preferred the bus to the tram/subway combination even though the bus took longer. The tram to the funicular only runs on holidays and weekends. Tips: Many things are not open in Barcelona on Sunday (as is the case in many European cities). If flying from North America, an evening flight on Saturday or Sunday during the day would be a good bet – that way you will sleep away the day that has the least amount going on.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunny P
Reviews.Content: Booked a lastminute.com deal. Hotel room was very ok (you get what you pay for (not all lights were working and the heating was not working during cold nights). Nevertheless for a 3 day stay this didnt affect us. As mentioned by most the location isn't ideal however as my wife and I are young we didnt mind the 30-45 minute journey into the centre and hardly noticed the treavel time during our stay. Tip: if you want to save some money get the L77 bus outside the airport to the airport. The bus arrives every 30mins and is siutated approx 2min walk right hand side of the main taxi rank. Costs €2 each and takes approx. 45 mins to arrive at the hotel (last stop: hotel can be seen from a far) Also look out for a cafe called 'Coffee Corner' approx. 2mins walk directly opposite the hotel. They do amazing 'cafe con leches' the best I had in Barca and nice omlette baguettes at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Black_Cavalier
Reviews.Content: Again, as the previous reviewer has mentioned, I would agree with the concensus of these reviews. Pros: as previously mentioned, clean, spacious, low cost, easy to get to if a little laborious, loved the kitchenette, great views, wifi excellent for watching the rugby & football. Cons: couch hard as it acts as an extra double bed, not appetising to settle down for the evening on, the small fee mentioned by a previous reviewer is 5 euro per hour for keeping the apartment longer. Would have given it 5 stars if not for the fee of retaining the apartment for longer.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: couple048
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a week. The hotel was very good, clean and the staff were extremly helpful. Although it was quite a way out of town, it was very easy to catch tram and metro to centre. We caught the Tram 3 to Palau Raul then caught the Metro Line 3 to Drassners, an ideal stop to start exploring. Recommend to buy a T10 ticket which serves all types of transport it lasts for 10 journeys and only cost 9.25 euros. Going on tram and metro only counts as one journey excellent value!! A few restaurants around hotel must try the WOK behind the big Meronda Supermarket excellent value. So much to do in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MariusW
Reviews.Content: It's pretty far away from center, but with the tram you will be there in no time. The rooms are big, the staff very friendly. There are some little kitchen in the room so you can cook your own food and save some money. Everything was very clean and they have a nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent value”
Reviews.Author: Dmitry_Russia_77
Reviews.Content: This is excellent choice for value budget. Large rooms, good equipment, silence in room and friendly stuffs. And all of these advantages are for not much cost! For economy travelers is able kitchen (supermarket is nearby hotel) - the best alternative of expensive breakfasts. Only one disadvantage of this hotel is a location. To far from city center (you need get by bus or tram and subway). But I didn't upset because I could view many non tourist places.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Junky87
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried about getting to this hotel as it seems a long way from the city centre. From the train station we caught the L5 to Cornella Centre which connects with the T2 tram to Levant les Planes. From there it is a 15 minute walk to the hotel. You can see the hotel name in lights from the final tram stop. Our room was great! It was the biggest room we had in 4 months of holidaying. Huge bathroom with a bath too. We had great views looking out over the city from our room also. The room had a fridge and kitchenette (although no cookware, but available from reception). There is a supermarket on the walk back from the tram stop which means you can easily self cater while staying here. We did not as there are so many great places to eat around La Ramblas. The wifi was slow which was disappointing and the service was average from reception - nothing particularly bad, just not great.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamesa1980
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean,but basic hotel. The staff are very helpful, although at times there were no staff to be seen! The hotel is not in Barcelona itself, but is very easily reached on public transport, takes about 40 minutes. The reasonable price makes this journey worthwhile. Hotel staff have timetables and the tramstop is 2 minutes away. To reach the hotel from the airport take but L77 which costs just 1.45 euros. The hotel is the last stop on this route. I was disappointed to find that the hotel bar and restaurant are closed at weekends. However, there are a couple of nice places just a few minutes walk away. My room had a sitting area with basic kitchen and also a bedroom with aircon and safety box. I would stay here again as I think it's better value for money than staying in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a couple on a budget”
Reviews.Author: megan8486
Reviews.Content: My fiance and i stayed here for 4 night at the beginning of April. When we got off the plane at Barcelona airport, i was a bit scared about getting public transport to the hotel, but we decided to try it and it was fantastic, and so cheap (T10 ticket for 10 journeys on all the public transport is only 8 euro). It is quite far to get from airport to city centre, then on to hotel - you have to get the train from the airport, switch onto metro then onto tram or bus, but the public transport system is really easy to follow (way easier than London!) and ticket machines are in English. On our first go from the airport it took us about an hour to get to the hotel, but for journeys from the hotel into and out of the city you can do it on the tram and metro in half an hour. Tram and bus stops really close to the hotel. There's a Mercadona (supermarket) right opposite one of the tram stops near the hotel and also a little convenience store and a bakery around the corner from the hotel entrance, so it's easy to pick up some food for a cheap easy dinner back in your hotel room (the kitchenette with fridge was a godsend) and for packed lunches to have whilst you're visiting one of Barcelona's fantastic sights! We saved so much money eating this way rather than eating in restaurants. Room was basic but clean, shower was lovely. Only downside was the walls were a bit thin, so if you get noisy neighbours (as we did on 2 of the nights), you won't sleep too well. Also, we found out that if you want to have pots & cutlery etc for the kitchenette you have to ask at reception when you arrive, otherwise these won't be provided. We didn't use the pool, spa or gym but apparantly these were available for guests. Overall, it was a great base for our trip to Barcelona. If you're happy to use public transport to get around then it's great and very cheap to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and nice”
Reviews.Author: vikabresp
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice hotel, three stars, and you receive what you payed. The bad thing is the parking, terrible to enter with the car, you might get a scratch there... However, is very well placed, there's Mercadona and a Sirena near, so, as the rooms have kitchen, you can buy food and prepare it. The breakfast is very good, but be sure to ask for it at reception or it might be more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “excellent all round !”
Reviews.Author: bubble88manchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic the facilities were brill. The pool was a very pleasant surprise as was the sunshine ! The staff were great they helped us with location , maps , and amentities. Our room had a balcony over looking the pool and the kitchenette was a god send . The local Mercadona (supermarket) was 10 min walk (stroll) max and really reasonable with everything u could need and all fresh. To the back of our hotel was a small precinct which included a chemist , bar and 2 restuarants of which the traditional one was stunning. The tram stop for T3 was just the other side of the hospital which was next door to the hotel. This then took you to Paul Riel from where you could join the green line metro and from there you could go anywhere. The T10 ticket is the best value at just 7.95 euro for 10 journeys on either tram or metro.But the best bit is that once your ticket is stamped (in the machines on board) you can get on and off as many trams or metros as you like for 1 hr 15mins and not use up any more of your journeys !!. Getting off at the Liceau stop on the Green Line brings you up right in the middle of the La Ramblas and very near to the Bouquiera Market.The journey from hotel to Liceau via Tram and then Metro took 40 mins max and the last Metro/Tram back was approx 2am which means you can enjoy the city for longer. The city has sooo much to offer the big red tour bus is a fab idea to get your bearings but a good wander is also a top idea. Airport to Hotel is easy also, the L77 bus from outside the airport takes you door to door and for just 1.45 euro ......bargain ! You can also travel by tram and metro I believe but the bus seemed the best option as no changes , espeically with suitcases this was easier. The area where the Hotel is, San Joan Despi is lovely as well with a huge park at the bottom of the hotel road and the precinct I mentioned before. I went with my best mate as a birthday treat and we had a top time ! But I believe that families and couple would enjoy this hotel and location also.

Reviews.Title: “Good. Easy to find if you plan first.”
Reviews.Author: RobWedekind
Reviews.Content: Nice clean good value apartment rooms for Barcelona. Room was made up every day. Got an Expedia special offer so got third night free. Room was spacious with nice kitchenette, sofa, seperate bedroom, fairly nice view from windows. To get there: Buy a TMB Zone One (1/3/7 Day) T-Dia pass. Use Subway or Rodalies / FGC Train to ''Cornella Centre'' (15mins from City) At Cornella use T2 Tram to last stop Llevant Les Planes (10mins) You will see the hotel up the hill as you step off the tram. (Ignore all the buses. They are useless and go to pointless places, or take ages) Self Catering....? Mercadona Supermarket on way between tram stop and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but vary hard to get to city centre and attractions.”
Reviews.Author: reecepoutawera
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice and very reasonably priced. The rooms were clean and the staff friendly. The downside was that it is a very long way from the city and it takes over 1 hour to get there on the bus. Therefore, I would only recommend staying here if you have a car or no interest in going in to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great , if you have a car!”
Reviews.Author: pepsii
Reviews.Content: Great value for money very close to all Barcelona attractions. We've got special package with breakfast and minibar included - both were adequate . The suites were nicely furnished , warm and quite large . Recommended if you have a car and on budget.

Reviews.Title: “The darkest spot for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: cu_gq
Reviews.Content: If you fancy heat stroke, because the hotel has no individual temperature control, and heating is on October 1 regardless of temperature outside, this is a fine hotel. Also if you like to smell like a skunk until 11 pm because the maid takes away towels and does not replace them for all the people. It is also a fine hotel. If breathing disorders due to pollution of the construction site across the street and all the smokers around you are features you like, this is then an excellent hotel. I may also add the construction site across the street makes the CIA look when it comes to sleep deprivation, no need for alarm clock with the noise you get from those. Now, if you are into a displaced misaligned spine because of the beds mattresses then you have also found an excellent hotel. If knee surgery is what you want, you found yourself the perfect place. You will need a new one after all the walking you do commuting from trains to trams or to buses coming and going from Barcelona. If you are more into

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mizmiah
Reviews.Content: my husband and i loved this hotel. we were initially (especially me) very worried due to reading a few bad reviews about it. we paid £90 for 3 nights from lastminute.com (an absolute bargain!!). when we arrived, the hotel looked lovely, reception area looked very professional and staff were very friendly. check in took longer than I've experienced at other hotels (10 mins), but we weren't bothered. when we go to our room, it was spotless. i quickly checked all surfaces (as had previously read reviews saying they were dirty etc). everything was clean, and most importantly, the bathroom was spotless! our bedroom looked great too, a huge double (it was really two single beds pushed together), but that wasn't a problem for us at all! sheets were white and clean, and they provided extra duvets in the wardrobe. there was plenty of wardrobe space and an easy to use safe (which i strongly recommend using for all monies and valuables inc cameras, coz you just never know!). we didnt find cutlery and pots and pans in the kitchen (which was also clean with plenty of cupboard space), and so asked reception for them. they told us they could only give them to us in the morning which i asked to be sent at 7.30am, and it was sent at that time. everything looked clean, but we washed all the pots and cutlery anyway! cleaners came in the room by 11am to clean, add new sheets, change towels (they only changed towels if you left them on the floor to signal you want new ones). they also cleaned the floor. my husband and i bumped into them only once and when we did they were really friendly and asked if we needed anything, even though we never asked. we couldnt really tell if the walls were thin, but we are assuming so because we neevr heard a peep from our neighbours, although you could hear a little noise from their bathroom (e.g water running), but this didnt bother us at all. we didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel anyway, because there was far more to see and do in Barcelona itself. it was really easy getting to the hotel: from girona airport, get on Barcelona Bus to Barcelona (stops off at Arc de Triof) - takes about an hour. The metro is just across the road (you could ask someone which direction). at the metro, jump onto the L1 (red line) heading towards Hospital De Bellvitge, then change at Espanya (L3 Green Line) heading towards Zona Universitaria, then get off the metro at Maria Cristina. You can then catch a 78 across the road. as soon as you get out of the metro system, turn left and cross the road there. Just look at the bus stops, they have numbers on them refering to which buses stop there. The bus stop you want is across the road, facing the huge shopping centre (on the other side of the road). the 78 will take you directly to the hotel, it stops right outside the front reception doors. Just ask the bus driver as we did and sit at the front of the bus if its your first time if your a little worried. the bus takes about 40mins. my husband and got back to the hotel late at night most of the time. the metro closes from midnight and most bus services cease from 10.30pm. You can catch the N15 (bus stop right outside the hotel) staright to Las Ramblas (and then catch N15 again to head back to the hotel). you can also catch the 78 or 157 buses (bus stop right outside the hotel) to get to town and vice versa. this will take about 50mins. we absolutely loved this hotel. the staff were friendly and polite. i would definetly stay at this hotel again, and seriosuly didnt mind the hour long journey into the heart of Barcelona. I guess that might have been because we stayed for 4 days only, but this was one of the best holidays I've been on! also, luckily, our room didnt face the hospital building site. it faced the fanstatic view of barcelona (well, we thought it was Barcy! lol). nonetheless. view was really lovely. we could also see the pool from our balcony. the pool wasnt great tbh. it wasnt heated and doesnt get much sun as it is surrounded by tall buildings. this didn't stop other people using it. we would have used the pool if it was heated, regardless of the tall buildings, but why bother with a communal ppol when you can go to Barceloneta (Barcelona's beach), which stretches for ages and is really clean (although lots of nudity! which isnt the nicest thing to see on some people). we didnt really like las ramblas, we got a dirty street vibe from it, although we did eat there few times (paellas). the resturaunts we went to were closer to Liceu metro stop on the Red line. we also had a caricature done 20euros for 2 people in one picture. it will be hanging on our wall very soon! depending on what your into, we checked out Parc Guell and were bored. we were recommeded to go there so we did, but only spent 30mins there, although it took 40mins to get there and back. waste of time, but glad we went only because we might have regretted it later. it's a pretty park with some beautiful views of the whole city and port, with some strange architecture, but it all just gets a little repetitive really. you can get there by getting off at Universitat (red line) metro stop, and jumping onto the 24 bus. there is an amazing bakery behind the hotel. they bake croissants and bread etc... PLEASE PLEASE try there croissants and bread as they are the best we've ever had in our lives! my mouth is watering now just thinking about it! also, try out the hotel's gym (free of charge) and jacuzzi and sauna.. it cost about 6euros each for 30mins each to use jacuzzi and sauna. we had fun, the pressure was great for my bad back. everything was clean too, and you'll find cleans towels ready for use there for you. you just have to book the day ahead. if you book it when you arrive, that might be best to use it the next day. also, when in las ramblas, be careful when ordering seafood paellas because i dont think they use very fresh fish/oysters/lobsters at some places, as i had a dodgey stomach a few times! In a nutshell, the hotel was brilliant, we would defo go again, but maybe not with kids because of the long journeys into the city. the only crap thing is the long journey to and from the hotel. otherwise, a great holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, great ammenities and good price just too far away from the city proper!”
Reviews.Author: ron14v
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. We had a great room over looking the entire city of Barcelona. It's near the hotel but we didn't know that it is far away from places we want to visit. It's our fault though, we didn't checked the distance. We wanted to experience Barcelona so we took public transportation. It was really cold that time and that made our trip back and forth to our hotel very difficult. But I'd stay there again if we're coming back for a summer visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: Simmo23
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful, especially when informing us of best travel routes, etc .The room was nice and roomy with a quality air con. Power shower was lovely (as always) and windows were nice and big with a light and heavy curtain. The only drawback with the room was that there were only 2 electic burners to use for cooking, instead of 4, but we coped. We also had the use of a microwave, which came in handy for the pizza! We watched snippets of satellite TV as there were only a handful of English programs. Location was the least most attractive feature of the hotel. However, where there's a will, there's a way and we were able to get a night bus (N15) back to the hotel from Las Ramblas. Mind you, the journey is 50 mins....make sure you don't fall asleep on the bus when travelling back! Bus stops 2 minutes from hotel. I would strongly advise you purchase a T10 ticket when travelling about town, which equates to a Travelcard here. Also, the T3 tram is much quicker for getting into town than the T2. Tram stops are 6 minutes walk from the hotel. In and around the hotel, there is a supermarket to the rear, which pretty much stocks most things you will need, including fresh produce. There are also a couple of restaurants/tapas bars. The taxi fare from the airport to the hotel is 25 euros. Overall, we'd give this hotel a rating of 8/10.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty. Avoid it.”
Reviews.Author: Chilli_tourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located far away from bars, restaurants and markets, making it hard to find good food except for a few local pubs - it is located in a residential area, away from the city's center. However, its main aspect is its lack of hygiene. Our room smelled like fish, my parent's room was totally cigarette-scented. Surfaces (as the counter in the small kitchen inside the apartment) were sticky.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DazzaMc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hesperia on the 3rd June for a week and was pleasantly surprised by the accomodation. The first thing I noticed was how spotless the hotel was, as were the rooms. The reception staff, although not the friendliest people in the world, were very helpful. One day I asked them if they knew where a certain street was and the woman looked it up for me on the computer and found it on a map and everything :) Was the most obscure street in Barcelona, too! The annoying this was that we didn't have a balcony (about half the hotels don't) and the view out the window was a building site. But we already knew that. And to be honest all we wanted was a base to sleep in as we visited the centre of Barcelona nearly every day so weren't too bothered. The pool was small but nice, wasn't very busy either so had no problem getting sunbeds. Had a peek at the gym and that looked good and very clean. There is a decent shop nearby which is reasonable and a nice bakery but that's about it. There are a few shabby looking restaurants which may well be nice but it's not a touristy area AT ALL so you will struggle if you don't speak spanish (as we don't .) We tried one of them on the 2nd night, the guy didn't speak any english but was friendly. The menus were all in spanish so me and my friend just ordered the only thing we understood - I had chicken and chips and he had pizza lol. After than we ventured out. We would highly recommend 'Tapa tapa' which is near Casa batllo and Casa Milla. Tapas is great, instead of ordering one meal you order a few little ones :) Also there's a restaurant called 'Freeway' on Av. Diagonal which costs 13 euros I think but that's all you can eat - salads, chinese food, freshly cooked meat (you order what ever you want) and desserts. Just a word of warning regarding public transport. It's not as easy as people make out! We had a horrendous time trying to find the hotel. It took us about 4 hours to get from the bus station in Barcelona to the hotel! We didn't have a clue which ticket to get and there was noone to help us. I would not advise if you were travelling alone and especially if the flight arrives late in Barcelona or Girona. I went with a friend and felt very vulnerable and unsafe. Got to the hotel at midnight :( Mabye it didn't help that the friend I went with didn't have a clue and left it all up to me! You do save money though. If you're gonna be using public transport a lot (bear in mind the hotel is far out so you probably will) I would advise getting a Barcelona card - includes all your transport and some discounts at attractions. We got a T10 card which gives you 10 journeys (thats 10 JOURNEYS so if you caught a bus then a metro it would count as 1 journey.) I think it was 7 euros but that was for 1 zone only and we went through loads of zones! Nobody checked the ticket but to be on the safe side get a Barcelona card as the T10 cards for 2 or more zones were expensive. If you're flying from Girona - Leave the airport, go to where the buses are and , as you look at it from the airport , the bus stop you need to get to Barcelona is on the right hand side (one bus goes to Barcelona, the other goes to Girona centre!) Buy a 'Barcelona Bus' ticket from the rather unfriendly ticket woman (20 euros I think return) and make sure you get the right bus! Once you reach the main bus station (1 hour 20 mins away) get off the bus and you need to go up some stairs and cross the main road and you'll see a red 'M' sign for the metro (metro is underground, like the tube.) This is called 'Art de Triomf' metro station. Buy a T10 ticket or a Barcelona ticket or whatever you want (there is a button to press to get the screen in english) and get on the red line heading to Bellvitge ( might say Hospital de Bellvitge.) Get off at Catalunya. Then get on the Green metro line and get off at Maria Cristina. You need to exit the metro station onto the main street - then you have 2 options. Get a tram or a bus. I would highly recommend the bus - get a 157 or a 78. It will drop you off right outside the hotel . If you take the tram get off at San Marti de l'Erm but it's a 10 minute walk from the hotel (again - not a good idea if it's late at night.) To get from the hotel to anywhere decent :) then take a 157 bus outside the hotel which will take you straight to La Ramblas but takes about an hour - or take a 78 bus , get off at Maria Cristina and get the metro from there to wherever you wanna go. like I said the first day was awful but after that I quickly got the hang on public transport and found it to be excellent. I would recommend : Sagrada Familia (dont bother with the combined ticket as it includes Park Guell which is closed anyway! Only a small section open and its free to the public) La Ramblas Montjuic (you have to get a special metro called Funicular Montjuic I think to get there as it's so high up but it's included in T10 or Barcelona card or whatever.) There's a Castle, Olympic Football Stadium, Magic Fountains, Art galleries, etc... Get there early as by the time we went the Castle was still open but none of the rooms were. Plus the Magic Fountains are not on every day! I think it said Thurs, Fri and Sat in the evening - we made the mistake of sitting around waiting for it on the Wednesday before we read the sign properly!! Castle and Olympic stadium are free, as is the 'Caixa Forum' art gallery which is excellent - modern art. The cable car to get from where the metro stops to Montjuic itself is expensive so just get a bus instead - goes to exactly the same place. You can use your t10 / barcelona card too. Casa Milla - a beautiful example of Gaudi's work. Cost about 10 euros, though. Casa Battlo round the corner was 13 euros so we couldn't afford to do both!! Cathedral (free after 5 o clock!) Gothic Church in the Gothic Quarter - closes about 3 I think Singers / musicians in the Gothic Quarter outside the Cathedral I think that's a long enough article! If you want any more information about anything, send me a message I'd be happy to help you. Oh and - don't get excited about the wi fi it's really slow!

Reviews.Title: “Self contained but way out of town”
Reviews.Author: Britannic
Reviews.Content: Decent sized suite with kitchen,lounge and seperate bed and bathroom. Staff friendly enough and spoke good English. Major problem was the location,this hotel is a fair Metro trip away from Las Ramblas and the City Centre so be prepared to travel! One place in Barcelona to certainly miss is the quite awful waxwork museum,great for a laugh but a real task to recognize any of the subjects on offer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and inexpensive, but a bit outside the city”
Reviews.Author: sweetsarahj
Reviews.Content: The staff here are friendly and speak English. There is free wireless internet, as well as a computer availible for use with a charge of 3 euros per 15 minutes. The suite was a good size, with a separate room with two double beds, and another full bed as well as a couch in the living area. It also had a kitchenette with a fridge. It would be an excellent placed to stay for a extended period of time. It is a bit outside the city, you have to take a tram and then the subway to get to the rambla. But it was only about 15 minutes to get to airport by taxi. Overall, a good spot.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: egern
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week. Nice hotel with very friendly staff! The rooms are 2-room apartments (living room + bed room) including a small kitchen with a fridge, microwave and two heating plates. When we arrived the living room table was sticky with spilled soda and there was a significant amount of dust by the windows, but apart from that, cleaning was fine throughout. The hotel offers free wifi, but the lack of speed rendered it useless. The breakfast is fine, with toast, rolls and pastry and a variety of fruit. Severel kinds of juice. Hot cocoa if you ask the staff. The hotel is located in an area under development with some office and residential buildings nearby. Contrary to information stated by other reviewers, there is in fact a small grocery store just 50-100 meters away opened till 20:00. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but don't use it unless your only aim is to satisfy your hunger - the food is incredibly boring! There is a direct bus connection with the city center 50 meters from the hotel, if you take bus 157. It takes 40-45 minutes to reach downtown. It may appear a disadvantage that the hotel is located so far from city center, but we actually ended up enjoying the bus ride back to our quiet little retreat after roaming the noisy streets of the inner city. It got to feel like home to us. We definately recommend the hotel, and as already stated - the staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: BirtyB
Reviews.Content: We'd read various reviews about this place so were prepared for the commute to the centre, etc.. Although the journey was on average 40 mins, it felt like half that. We ended up getting a couple of T10 tickets which worked out good value - just remember to swipe them within an hour and a 1/4 of your last swipe, otherwise it will print a time a date on the back of the ticket which will signify another of your 10 journeys has been used. We flew with Ryanair to Girona, got a return "Barcelona Bus" ticket for 21 € which dropped us off at the main bus depot in Barcelona (Estació del Nord). From there we crossed the road to the Arc de Trionf and made our way on to the L1 (red) metro heading towards Hospital De Bellvitge. We then changed at Espanya and boarded the L3 (green) metro heading towards Zona Universitaria. We then got off the metro at Maria Cristina and boarded a T3 Tram (over the road) heading towards Sant Feliu / Consell Comarcal and got off at the Sant Marti de l' Erm. When you get off the Tram, the hotel is on the other side of the busy road. Thankfully for us we arrived at night so saw the Blue Neon Hotel name on top of the hotel. Because we arrived late, the little Grocery store literally around the back of the hotel (which sold pretty much everything you'd ever need (apart from cigarettes!)) was closed so we went to the Petrol Service station which was in the opposite direction back on the main street a little further up. There we stocked up on a few essentials (bread, milk, etc). The hotel room iteslf was spacious, clean and well laided out. Good beds with extra blankets in wardrobe. We had to ask for the Kitchen stuff to be brought up and it was delivered in a box the following morning. In there you get a very basic selection comprising frying pan, two sausepans, two sets of knives / forks / spoons, two plates, two dishes, can opener, ladle. Strangley however no Kettle. We asked for one though and it was delivered to our room within five minutes. TV has 30 channels - all spanish except Eurosport and Sky News both in English (Bonus!). Also worth mentioning is the Barcelona Card (google it) which once bought pays for pretty much all your transport, and entitles you free or discounted entrance on certain Attractions & Restaurants. Whatever you do though keep your travel passes as straight as possible. We bent one of ours and renderred it useless. Overall, we were super impressed with both Bacelona and the Hotel. The transportation system they have is brilliant and although we were initially a litle overwhelmed by it, we quickly worked it out.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: tanakken
Reviews.Content: I would nevery recommend this place to anyone. Dirty and old. The only positive was its close proximity to the airport. Dirty sofa and dustballs, and slow check-in computers.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Suite if not a little far from City Centre”
Reviews.Author: lakes
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to this hotel and the lovely city of Barcelona. Yes - you do have to travel from the hotel to the city centre but with the fantastic tram service (T3 service only 5 minute walk from hotel) and the excellent metro system - this took little more than 45 mins. I would suggest buying the T10 travel card that allows ten journeys covering trams/metro/buses etc. Its simple to use, however, please make sure that you have change with you as the automated machine did not accept notes. The hotel itself is clean. Staff friendly, suites spacious. Maid service daily - couldn't fault the hotel at all - Barcelona itself is amazing - we had three full days in Barcelona but could have stayed longer - so much to see and it seems so little time to fit it all in. Fantastic architectural sights (Sagrada Familia, La Pedrera or as it is also called, Casa Mila and Casa Batllo), great open spaces (Park Guell), great views from the cable car to Montjuic and the Funicular to Tibidabo and a great public transport system all go towards making your stay in Barcelona one to remember! Please make a visit to the Gothic Quarter ( Barri Gotic) and take a ride on one of the Trixi bikes - you are shown the "real" Barcelona and its an experience not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - ideal for a week or more stay”
Reviews.Author: s_neill
Reviews.Content: Much already has been documented about the distance of the hotel from the city centre, all I would add is if it’s a weekend city break you require, perhaps try something more central, else it’s not a major issue – the hotel is well served by Metro, tram and night bus. Once inside, you’ll find the hotel decorated to a modern décor and is more than comfortable. The bathroom is good, as is the room, with sheets being laundered daily. Reception staff are very friendly, helpful and obliging. The pool is pleasant, in a courtyard comprising the hotel and surrounding apartments and is very quiet and peaceful. Breakfast wasn’t included in the price, and is comparable with other hotels at EUR 10. As for its quality, I am not aware as my guest and I made use of the local – and much talked about – bakery, which cheap and a fine array of products. There is also a local convenience store which sells just about everything you’d need. In summary, the hotel is excellent and is ideal if the purpose of your trip is to unwind and visit downtown Barcelona as and when.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice - pool rubbish”
Reviews.Author: luippaSurrey_
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hesperia Sant Joan Suites last year with my boyfriend. The reason we choose this hotel is that we both wanted an outdoor pool. However the pool itself is not great - it is in the middle of four very tall buildings so rarely gets any sun, so if your like me and want to get all the sun you can squeeze in, this isn't the pool for you!! Luckily Barcelona has a fab beach so we made the effort to travel in everyday (which all in all takes about 40 mins.) I really would recommend staying at a hotel closer to the centre of Barcelona even though travel is cheap and simple. Barcelona is an amazing city with great culture, so good me and my boyfriend are returning this year! Apart from the location the Hesperia Sant Joan Suites is a lovely hotel, very clean, good size and the Kitchenette is something that will be missed this year as it saved us so much money! Hope you enjoy your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “5 day break in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Mlee21
Reviews.Content: I agree with other reviews where the hotel is not 10 minutes away from the centre of Barcelona. However, depsite the location of the hotel.....there's nothing else bad to say about it. The staff were friendly, the hotel was clean, and the room was excellent. The room was perfect and very spacious. Use the T3 tramline and change at Maria Cristina to use the metro. The T10 ticket card was perfected as it suited our needs. Just remember to keep validating the card each time you board a train, tram, or bus. You get an hr and quarter with an option to change your transport type upto 3 times to reach your destination. If this is within your hr and quarter limit, the machine will recognise this and will not take a ticket allowance from your 10 tickets. It is around 10 mins on tram to Camp Nou. We visited this on our first day, was magnificent. We followed this with a bearings trip to find our way around the city. There's a great beach at Barcelonetta which takes around 45 mins to reach from the hotel. If you do visit the hotel, make sure you visit the small shops round the corner from hotel. It is situated just behind the hotel and there is this small bakery that allows you to eat in. Here they do a small choice of tapas also that was brilliant. We never found this until our last day unfortunately. The food we had here beat any other food we had in spain. The only downside to the hotel facilities is that to order room service, in the brochure it states that you ring up room service and then they put you through directly to the pizza place. They give you a seperate number to call which you do get charged for. The food was great and you don't pay for this until you check out. I didn't like the way they say you get put through directly but then this is just nit-picking the only bad thing about the hotel than just the location. If you do arrive late and require food after midnight, then there is a 24 hr garage around a 5-10 minute walk by the tram stop. They sell everything you need really regards to sandwiches, sweets, nd drinks (50% cheaper than what's inside the fridge). The hotel is away from the hustle and bustle of la ramblas and is in a very quiet neighbourhood. If this is what you are after then this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: GerryBradley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sant Joan for four days in early October. The suite had everything, fridge, cooker, crockery, washing-up liquid etc. All for £42 per night and the 4th. night free. In Barcelona !! It was about 35 minutes fron city centre via metro and tram. Expedia handled the booking really well. Very clean and in a quiet area. I will return the next time I stay in Barcelona.
